newsitem.title: USA: USDA pegs 96/97 world sugar trade at 35.5 mln MT.
newsitem.headline: USDA pegs 96/97 world sugar trade at 35.5 mln MT.

text.p: The U.S. Agriculture Department Wednesday pegged world centrifugal sugar trade at 35.5 million tonnes in 1996/97, up one percent from the prior season and estimated world usuage at 122.9 million tonnes.
In its Sugar: World Markets and Trade report, USDA forecast world sugar output at 125 million tonnes, unchanged from a previous estimate released earlier this month.
USDA said increased export prospects for Brazil, the European Union, Australia and India accounted for most of the higher trade forecast.
Russia, the United States and China are expected to be leading importers, it added.
Sugar consumption is forecast to rise nearly 4 percent from the prior year, with the most significant increases in consumption found in Asia, USDA said.
